thread.title: Kaizer Chiefs announce new sponsorship
thread.title_full: Kaizer Chiefs announce new sponsorship - Times LIVE

author: Marc Strydom
title: Kaizer Chiefs announce new sponsorship
text:
Kaizer Chiefs announce new sponsorship Marc Strydom | 08 February, 2017 12:44 One of the Toyota vehicles that Kaizer Chiefs will use after the club announced a sponsorship deal with the car manufacture on Wednesday 8 February 2017. Kaizer Chiefs chairman Kaizer Motaung announced a new transport sponsorship from car manufacturer Toyota at the Soweto soccer giants' headquarters in Naturena outside Soweto on Wednesday. Toyota replace Nissan as Chiefs’ transport partner.
“These two iconic brands say a lot about being in a partnership‚” Motaung said.
“We couldn’t have chosen a better car sponsor than Toyota because they have a very large car manufacturing footprint in the country‚ and they are one of the biggest car manufacturers in the world.”
Motaung said while the sponsorship was aimed directly at bolstering Chiefs’ resources on the field‚ such partnerships are crucial to the overall success of the club.
This Toyota Rav 4 is beautiful @KaizerChiefs pic.twitter.com/6Rcca3rZeM
— #NewAgeJacobZuma (@Tutumolale) February 7, 2017
